Issues.Title: [LOC] Don't translate Home, Backspace, End and Enter keys in KeysConverter for Japanese.
Issues.Body:
### Which files are affected?

src/System.Windows.Forms/src/Resources/xlf/SR.ja.xlf

### Which languages are affected?

Japanese

### Problem
Currently, following keys is translated in Japanese:
- toStringHome
- toStringBack
- toStringEnd
- toStringEnter

### Expected
Home, Backspace, End and Enter keys in Japanese keyboard is not translated.

(Reference) Japanese osk.exe screenshot:
![JapaneseOsk](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38393610/210160934-084589d8-a1b6-4236-b3a7-f1ed8c31123f.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[LOC] Don't translate Home, Backspace, End and Enter keys in KeysConverter for Japanese." (#8440)

Issues.Title: Fix keyboard layout name returned from System.Windows.Forms.InputLanguage.LayoutName
Issues.Body:
Properly convert HKL to KLID string according to the comment from Windows team at https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/4345#issuecomment-759161693

Don't need to look at `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Keyboard Layout\Substitutes` at all since HKL is already have all needed information.

Fixes #4345 


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8439)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix keyboard layout name returned from System.Windows.Forms.InputLanguage.LayoutName" (#8439)

Issues.Title: System.InvalidOperationException: 'Object is currently in use elsewhere.'  occurs when using BackgroundWorker.
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .Net 6.0 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? _No response_ ### Issue description I have drawn and animated an image inside the BackgroundWorker in a ButtonClick. If I click the button continuously to show the animated image, the form is sent to not respond for a few seconds. When debugging the code, it throws a System.InvalidOperationException: 'Object is currently in use elsewhere.' in the DrawImage method. **Image Reference** ### Steps to reproduce 1. Run the sample. 2. Click the button continuously, the form is not responding for a few seconds. If I add breakPoint in a button click, then throws an exception in Graphics.DrawImage method. [WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10319714/WinFormsApp1.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.InvalidOperationException: 'Object is currently in use elsewhere.'  occurs when using BackgroundWorker." (#8438)

Issues.Title: Fix UIA tree structure for MenuStrip
Issues.Body:
Fixes #8433


## Proposed changes

- Fix values of IsControlElementProperty and IsContentElementProperty properties in MenuStrip, ToolStripDropDown and ToolStripItem accessible objects as described in 
[UI Automation Support for the Menu Control Type](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/ui-automation/ui-automation-support-for-the-menu-control-type) and [UI Automation Support for the MenuItem Control Type](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/ui-automation/ui-automation-support-for-the-menuitem-control-type)

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- JAWS for Windows announces top-level menu item without adding "sub menu"

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![JAWS before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/209850305-31ce0e1d-f8b9-4e69-ad2f-ff479cdebbd0.png)

> Menu bar
> File sub menu
> To navigate press Left or Right Arrow.
> f
> Edit sub menu
> e
> Tools sub menu
> t
> menu
> Customize
> To move through items press up or down arrow.
> c
> Options sub menu
> o
> Settings...

### After

![JAWS after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/209850372-62440aa0-e5c8-4c9c-ae52-4672626e0875.png)

> Menu bar
> File
> To navigate press Left or Right Arrow.
> f
> Edit
> e
> Tools
> t
> menu
> Customize
> To move through items press up or down arrow.
> c
> Options sub menu
> o
> Settings...

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET 7.0.1


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: JAWS for Windows reports each item of the horizontal menu bar as having a submenu
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 7.0.1

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

Related to #7770.

When navigating through MenuStrip top level items, JAWS announces each as "<item name>, sub menu".

![JAWS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/113603457/209844932-dcd2e5c5-ff15-437a-ae25-455e69b4bc40.png)

> Menu bar
> File sub menu
> To navigate press Left or Right Arrow.
> f
> Edit sub menu
> e
> Tools sub menu
> t
> menu
> Customize
> To move through items press up or down arrow.
> c
> Options sub menu
> o
> Settings...

### Steps to reproduce

Sample app: [WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10315328/WinFormsApp1.zip)

Build and run the above WinFormsApp1 application.
Run JAWS.
Press Alt key to focus on the first menu item.
Press right key several times to observe other items.
JAWS announces each as "<item name>, sub menu".
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "JAWS for Windows reports each item of the horizontal menu bar as having a submenu" (#8433)

Issues.Title: UIA focus is not returned back to menu item after closing dropdown
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.0-alpha.1.22622.1

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

Related to #7770.

After closing MenuStrip's submenu, UIA focus doesn't switch back to the top-level menu item, which may cause issues for screen readers. 

#### Current behavior

In Narrator:
![A gif demonstrating the issue when using Narrator: after closing the dropdown via Escape, focus highlight rectangle stays on now invisible menu item](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102954094/209823124-e658ca9d-81ed-4d93-854b-d75f109dc3f1.gif)

> [Press Alt]
> menuStrip1, Project, menu item, collapsed, 
> [Press Down arrow]
> Project, menu, 
> New, menu item, Ctrl+ N, 
> [Press Escape]

There is no announcement that focus is now on Project menu item after pressing Escape.

In JAWS:
![A gif demonstrating the issue when using JAWS: after closing the dropdown via Escape, menu is reopened and announced again as context menu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102954094/209821377-4e6a0727-787c-4392-a1e7-5e9c9e7a4ba1.gif)

> [Press Alt]
> Menu bar 
> Project sub menu 
> [Press Down arrow]
> menu 
> New Ctrl+N 
> [Press Escape]
> Context Menu 
> Project 
> menu 
> New Ctrl+N 
> [Press Escape]
> Context Menu 
> Project 
> menu 
> New Ctrl+N

After closing the dropdown, submenu is reopened and announced again as a context menu.


NVDA is similar to Narrator but focus moves to the whole window instead of staying on closed dropdown item.


#### Expected behavior

After dropdown is dismissed, top-level menu item is announced as currently focused item, and the focus highlight moves to it. 


### Steps to reproduce

1. Add a MenuStrip with a menu item with submenu (e.g. via Insert Standard Items button), or open Menus form on WinformsControlsTest app.
2. Start Narrator
3. Expand and close the menu item
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "UIA focus is not returned back to menu item after closing dropdown" (#8432)

Issues.Title: Continuous stream of window paint message occurs when overriding CreateParams
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net6.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

Continuous stream of window paint message occurs when overriding CreateParams  and using BitBlt() function

### Steps to reproduce

Create a custom control by deriving form control class.
Override Wndproc and handle the WM_NCPAINT and customize the border drawing using BitBlt() function.
Also override the Create Params.

Note:
Continuous stream of window message occurs.

Expected behavior:
Continuous stream of window message calls should not occurs, Border should be properly rendered.

Attached the sample :
[WinformsSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10293445/WinformsSample.zip)

Samples Replication procedure:
1.Run the sample
2.Note in output window, continuous message calls will be shown using Debug.WriteLine().
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Continuous stream of window paint message occurs when overriding CreateParams " (#8421)

Issues.Title: ActiveX Code Shuffling
Issues.Body:
Move the Control ActiveX interfaces to their own file and move the remaining interfaces to CsWin32.

Pull out the nested AxContainer.ExtenderProxy class.

Remove unused Interop code.

Issues.Title: [dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1] When multiple toolstrips add to top panel of ToolStripContainer, System.InvalidCastException will throw
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

```
.NET SDK:
Version:   8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1
Commit:    8750a90545
Runtime Environment:
OS Name:     Windows
OS Version:  10.0.19045
OS Platform: Windows
RID:         win10-x64
Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1\

Host:
 Version:      8.0.0-alpha.1.22605.1
 Architecture: x64
 Commit:       1a37caf773

.NET SDKs installed:
  8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.22615.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.22605.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.22614.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
```

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

**Verify Scenarios:**
1). Windows10 21H2 x64+dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22621.5: Fail
2). Windows10 21H2 x64+dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1: Fail
3). Windows10 21H2 x64+dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22616.7: Fail
4). Windows 10 21H2 x64 + dotnet-sdk-7.0.101: Pass

### Issue description

When testing the 3rd Party App with .NET 8 runtime,  System.InvalidCastException will throw if multiple toolstrips are added to top panel of ToolStripContainer.

**Application Name**:  mRemoteNG
**OS**: Windows 10 21H2
**CPU:** X64
**.NET Build Number:** dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1

App or App Source code checking at:  https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1709163
**Github Link:** 
https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG

### Steps to reproduce

**Repro steps:**
**The machine only has 8.0 installed. And DOTNET_ROLL_FORWARD_ON_NO_CANDIDATE_FX=2 is set.**

1. Copy mRemoteNG app to local machine.
2. Launch mRemoteNG.exe

**Expected Result:** 
Application can launch successfully.

**Actual Result:**
Application launch failed with below exception:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83067197/209086429-9bec6a8c-aa51-408c-af8a-1f24f6851da5.png)

**Minimal Repro sample:**
Minial repro sample attached.[ToolTipDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10284921/ToolTipDemo.zip)

1. Create a .NET 7.0 WinForm app.
2. Add following code in Form1.Designer.cs file:
```
       private ToolStripContainer toolStripContainer1;
        private ToolStrip toolStrip1;
        private ToolStrip toolStrip2;

        private void InitializeComponent()
        {
            this.components = new System.ComponentModel.Container();
            this.AutoScaleMode = System.Windows.Forms.AutoScaleMode.Font;
            this.ClientSize = new System.Drawing.Size(800, 450);
            this.Text = "Form1";

            toolStripContainer1 = new ToolStripContainer();
            toolStrip1 = new ToolStrip();
            toolStrip2 = new ToolStrip();
            toolStrip1.Items.Add("One");
            toolStrip2.Items.Add("Two");
            toolStripContainer1.TopToolStripPanel.Controls.Add(toolStrip1);
            //we add second to repro, if we remove this line, it will work
            toolStripContainer1.TopToolStripPanel.Controls.Add(toolStrip2);
            Controls.Add(toolStripContainer1);
        }
```
5. Build the project.
6. Change the runtimeconfig to let the app run against with .NET 8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1:
```
{
  "runtimeOptions": {
    "tfm": "net7.0",
    "frameworks": [
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.NETCore.App",
        "version": "8.0.0-alpha.1.22605.1"
      },
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App",
        "version": "8.0.0-alpha.1.22614.1"
      }
    ]
  }
}
```
8. Press F5 to launch the sample app.

**Excepted Result:**
App can launch and toolstrips will load on the form.

**Actual Result:**
This exception is thrown in code:
```
System.InvalidCastException: 'Unable to cast object of type 'System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Windows.Forms.Layout.IArrangedElement]' to type 'System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1[System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelCell]'.'
```
**Findings:**
When adding multiple tooltstrips to top panel of ToolStripContainer will cause this issue. If only 1 tooltip added, it won't trigger this exception.

@dotnet-actwx-bot @dotnet/compat
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1] When multiple toolstrips add to top panel of ToolStripContainer, System.InvalidCastException will throw" (#8415)

Issues.Title: [dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1] System.IndexOutOfRangeException: 'Index was outside the bounds of the array.' exception thrown when OpenFileDialog.Multiselect=true
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

```
.NET SDK:
Version:   8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1
Commit:    8750a90545
Runtime Environment:
OS Name:     Windows
OS Version:  10.0.19045
OS Platform: Windows
RID:         win10-x64
Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1\

Host:
 Version:      8.0.0-alpha.1.22605.1
 Architecture: x64
 Commit:       1a37caf773

.NET SDKs installed:
  8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.22615.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.22605.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 8.0.0-alpha.1.22614.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
```

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

**Verify Scenarios:**
1). Windows10 21H2 x64+dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22621.5: Fail
2). Windows10 21H2 x64+dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1: Fail
3). Windows10 21H2 x64+dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22616.7: Fail
4). Windows10 21H2 x64+dotnet-sdk-7.0.101: Pass


### Issue description

When testing the 3rd Party Apps with .NET 8 runtime, System.IndexOutOfRangeException: 'Index was outside the bounds of the array.' exception thrown when OpenFileDialog.Multiselect=true

**Application Name:**  paint.netcore, XamlViewer
**OS:** Windows 10 21H2
**CPU:** X64
**.NET Build Number:** dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1

**App or App Source checking at** : https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1709145

### Steps to reproduce

**Repro steps:**
**The machine only has 8.0 installed. And DOTNET_ROLL_FORWARD_ON_NO_CANDIDATE_FX=2 is set.**

1. Copy paint.net app to local machine.
2. Launch paintdotnet.exe.
3. Click File > Open.
4. Select one .png file, click Open button

**Expected Result:** 
The png file will be opened in paint.net app successfully.

**Actual Result:**
Open failed and app crashed with following error (The crash log file [pdncrash.1.log](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10284858/pdncrash.1.log) ):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83067197/209084984-ce15f133-fefb-4be9-85b0-324502050307.png)


**Minimal Repro sample:**
Minimal repro sample attached.
[OpenFileDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10284865/OpenFileDemo.zip)

1. Create a .NET 7.0 WinForm app.
2. Add following code in Form1.cs file:
```
 public Form1()
        {
            InitializeComponent();
            openFileDialog1 = new OpenFileDialog();

            selectButton = new Button()
            {
                Size = new Size(100, 20),
                Location = new Point(15, 15),
                Text = "Select file"
            };
            selectButton.Click += new EventHandler(selectButton_Click);
            Controls.Add(selectButton);
        }

        private Button selectButton;
        private OpenFileDialog openFileDialog1;


        private void selectButton_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
        {

            openFileDialog1.Multiselect = true; //This line of code will cause the exception

            if (openFileDialog1.ShowDialog() == DialogResult.OK)
            {
                try
                {

                    var filePath = openFileDialog1.FileName;

                }
                catch (Exception ex)
                {
                    MessageBox.Show($"Security error.\n\nError message: {ex.Message}\n\n" +
                    $"Details:\n\n{ex.StackTrace}");
                }
            }
        }
```
4. Build the project.
5. Change the runtimeconfig to let the app run against with .NET 8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1:
```
{
  "runtimeOptions": {
    "tfm": "net7.0",
    "frameworks": [
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.NETCore.App",
        "version": "8.0.0-alpha.1.22605.1"
      },
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App",
        "version": "8.0.0-alpha.1.22614.1"
      }
    ]
  }
}
```
7. Press F5 to launch the sample app.
8. Click Select button and select a file to open it.

**Excepted Result:**
No exception thrown.

**Actual Result:**
This exception is thrown in code:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83067197/209085295-824aeda5-4cc1-4467-89db-72b88463fd9a.png)

**Findings:**
This issue only occurs when Multiselect=true for OpenFileDialog. If we remove Multiselect=true from source code, this issue will go.

@dotnet-actwx-bot @dotnet/compat
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-alpha.1.22619.1] System.IndexOutOfRangeException: 'Index was outside the bounds of the array.' exception thrown when OpenFileDialog.Multiselect=true" (#8414)

Issues.Title: Enabling nullability annotations to `System.Windows.Forms.Design` classes
Issues.Body:
Enable Nullability in multiple Design classes.

This PR focuses on classes with low line counts to reduce the review burden.

Related: #8342
